Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?

common_issues.title: Authentication Issues in Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users reported various authentication issues, including failure to link accounts, login page freezing, and HTTP 500 errors. These problems were often related to updates, specific OS versions (Windows 11, Linux), and the authentication pipeline. Solutions involved using alternative login methods, restarting the authentication flow, and debugging by the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of Conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* John created an issue about his inability to link his Pieces accounts.
* Existing related issues were suggested, and helpful resources were provided.
* The current account linking flow was acknowledged as inadequate, with a replacement planned for mid-to-late February.

**Problems identified:**

* John's two accounts were not linked properly.
* Account linking flow was not straightforward.
* An email capitalization discrepancy might be causing issues.
* The authentication service was outdated and caused inconsistencies.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Merging accounts was proposed.
* Identifying the accounts to be merged.
* Resetting John's GitHub account.
* Temporarily disabling email privacy settings on GitHub.
* Transitioning to a new authentication service by the end of the month.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The new authentication system is not yet ready.
* John successfully linked his accounts after its release but in the wrong order.
* Resetting the account link is pending.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue was acknowledged, and troubleshooting steps were taken.
* John's patience and willingness to wait for the new system were appreciated.
* A further conversation is scheduled to resolve the remaining issue.

related_issues.title: Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
related_issues.text:
Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users are unable to link their Google accounts after updating to Pieces OS version 11.3.0.
* Login page https://authentication.pieces.services/ hangs indefinitely.
* Issue occurs on Windows 11.

**Problems Identified:**

* Authentication flow issue introduced in the new authentication pipeline.
* Manually refreshing the login page causes problems with the callback to the application.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Use the 'Connect Account' button in the Pieces Toolbar to log in.
* Restart the authentication flow if the login page is refreshed manually.
* Debug and fix the authentication pipeline issues.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Authentication is working again for most users.
* Issue has been resolved and closed.

**Additional Notes:**

* Users can provide support logs for further troubleshooting if needed.
* Issue appears to be specific to Windows 11.

**Overall, the issue has been identified and resolved. Users who are still experiencing problems should contact support for further assistance.**

related_issues.title: OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
related_issues.text:
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I try to log in via PFD, the spinner loads indefinitely before opening an error page in the browser:

https://pieces.app/authentication-error?sentry_id=00000000000000000000000000000000&os=bb009f04-7e79-44cb-8376-aba647cd2c98&platform=linux

In the OS logs (Documents/com.pieces.os/Support/logs) I see this entry:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
```

It is surrounded by HTTP 200s like this:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:53.075570  0:00:00.000685 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.038635  0:00:00.001700 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.043187  0:00:00.000732 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.335453  0:00:00.001876 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:56.077590  0:00:00.000695 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:59.079649  0:00:00.000662 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.081551  0:00:00.000486 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.272493  0:00:00.001839 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.334258  0:00:00.000938 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.457128  0:00:00.001378 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:05.083569  0:00:00.000541 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.085902  0:00:00.000518 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.094713  0:00:00.001812 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
```
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* @utrack reports a problem with authentication on Linux.
* @utrack provides calendar link for real-time debugging.
* @nathan-courtney-pieces requests log files and Linux OS information.
* @utrack provides log files and confirms using Arch Linux rolling.

**Problems identified:**

* Authentication issue on Linux.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* @utrack to turn on debug logs.
* @nathan-courtney-pieces analyzes log files.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is being investigated.
* Further debugging and analysis are needed.

**Additional notes:**

* The user has provided limited information about the specific issue.
* More details are needed to diagnose the problem and propose a solution.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS launch and login failures
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS failing to launch or login on Windows and Linux. Issues include database corruption, invalid port errors, and HTTP 500 errors during login. Proposed solutions involve reinstalling with WinGet, checking AVX2 support, and analyzing log files.

related_issues.title: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest from 17032025 (can't find it)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi I am stuck at the initial stages. Where the desktop app is being initialized. I am at verify dependency connections and it says unable to open pieces core services. "FormatException: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect.

It might be an antivirus stopping it. I am not sure. But I have restarted and reinstalled to no effect.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue:** Pieces not launching on Windows
**User:** SherlockSol
**Date:** March 17, 2025

**Key Points Raised:**

* SherlockSol reported the issue of Pieces not launching on their Windows PC.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.
* SherlockSol was asked to provide additional information, including logs and hardware details.

**Problems Identified:**

* The exact cause of the issue was initially unknown.
* The Pieces team was unable to reproduce the issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Nathan Courtney (Pieces team) asked SherlockSol to provide logs and hardware details.
* Mack At Pieces (Pieces team) suggested a video call to troubleshoot the issue live.
* Uzaxirr reported experiencing the same issue and was scheduled for a video call.
* Zedevmed discovered a potential solution: installing Pieces and Pieces Desktop using WinGet in an elevated PowerShell session.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The Pieces team is investigating the issue and trying to reproduce it.
* A workaround using WinGet has been identified and is being tested.
* The documentation will be updated to reflect the recommended installation method.

**Additional Notes:**

* Other users have reported experiencing the same issue.
* The cause of the issue is still being investigated.
* A video call is scheduled to gather more information and attempt to reproduce the issue.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The latest version doesn't start. 

Here is the log in com.pieces.os/production/Support/logs:

[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.605235  Starting OS_Server!
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.605235  Starting EnvConf
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.605235  Starting DeploymentInfo
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  Number: 218
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  Tag: 11.3.0
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  Branch: 11.3.0
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  SHA1: a59a1f114c021e83a6f42e696223dba9a670faa2
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  WinDeployType: exe
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  Channel : production
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  Process ID: 2076
[D]  Setting Url Protocol Scheme for Inno Setup/ Squirrel Installs
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.625235  Logging to file: C:\Users\antoine\Documents\com.pieces.os\production\Support/logs/log-04122025.txt
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.634236  Copying the vocab file to the data directory
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.634236  Successfully copied the vocab file
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.634236  Starting OS
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.660235  Starting OS
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.660235  Starting UI
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  UI#builder, hasData: false, hasError: false
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  stateStream#onListen
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  OS#boot
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  OS#attach
[38;5;12m[I][0m  initializeDataSingletons
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.991237  Created our Tagify Files Locally.
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.991237  User added tagify files now exist.
[D]  Setting WinToast Dismissed Callback
[D]  Setting WinToast Dismissed Callback
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 1ba7ab308a4b470ab996b360cc956398
[38;5;12m[I][0m  _controller.addError Unable to open database due to corruption LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #0      InternalCouchBaseDatabases.initializeCouchbase (package:database_facade/couchbase/singletons/internal_databases.dart)
<asynchronous suspension>
#1      OS.initializeDataSingletons (package:os_server/os.dart:909)
<asynchronous suspension>
#2      OS.boot (package:os_server/os.dart:652)
<asynchronous suspension>
#3      OS._controller.<anonymous closure>.<anonymous closure>.<anonymous closure> (package:os_server/os.dart:275)
<asynchronous suspension>

[D]  Sentry Error Event: 2a48d07355694369b880fa84ef743112
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 9f79ad8b81a1493c955f24b3cf97db7e
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:05.956756  UI#builder, hasData: false, hasError: true
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: timeout
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: Notification Timeout: Went into side panel
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: timeout
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: Notification Timeout: Went into side panel
## Conversation Summary: 

**Key points:**

* **Initial issue:** User reported an error during database initial bootup.
* **Troubleshooting:** Pieces support attempted to debug the issue remotely and suggested deleting the database folder.
* **Problem identified:** User's computer lacked AVX2 instruction set support, required by the CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch library used by Pieces OS.
* **Solution proposed:** Pieces support identified the core issue and developed a fix in version 11.3.2.
* **Outcome:** The issue was resolved with the release of version 11.3.2.

**Current status:** 

* The issue is resolved.
* Version 11.3.2 of Pieces OS is available with the fix.

**Further details:**

* The user provided valuable information about their hardware limitations, which helped identify the cause of the problem.
* Pieces support was responsive and communicated effectively throughout the process.

**Additional notes:**

* The user expressed concern about compatibility with older hardware, and Pieces support acknowledged this. 


**Overall, this conversation demonstrates the importance of clear communication and collaborative troubleshooting in resolving technical issues.**

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I try to log in via PFD, the spinner loads indefinitely before opening an error page in the browser:

https://pieces.app/authentication-error?sentry_id=00000000000000000000000000000000&os=bb009f04-7e79-44cb-8376-aba647cd2c98&platform=linux

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Database Corruption and Crash on Startup
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported Pieces OS crashing on startup or failing to launch due to database corruption on macOS and Windows. Issues arose after updating to versions 11.0.0 and above. Proposed solutions included checking for duplicate issues, scheduling support calls, and updating to the latest version (11.3.2) which included a fix for database initialization errors related to AVX2 instruction set incompatibility.

related_issues.title: Application Crash on Startup
related_issues.text:
Application Crash on Startup
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Upon launching the application, it crashes immediately with an error message stating "Unexpected error occurred." This issue started occurring after updating to version 11.0.0. The crash seems to be related to the new plugin integration. Steps to reproduce:


## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User @moazzem-pixel reported a crashing issue after updating to version 11.3.1 on macOS 12.3 with M2 MacBook Air.
* The user provided crash logs and relevant details about the hardware, plugins, and previous working version.

**Problems Identified:**

* The application was crashing upon launch after the update.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Support agent suggested a similar reported issue (https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/686) to check for a solution.
* If the suggested solution didn't work, user was advised to schedule a support call.
* As a final fix, the latest version (11.3.2) was suggested.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue was resolved with the latest version (11.3.2).
* User advised to reopen the ticket if the issue persists after updating.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Early Access Program

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS fails to start because it is unable to open the database due to corruption. The error message displayed is: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

Steps to Reproduce:

Attempt to start Pieces OS on macOS.
Observe the error message indicating database corruption.
Expected Behavior: I expected Pieces OS to start normally and access the database without any issues.
## GitHub issue conversation summary:

**Key points:**
* User moazzem-pixel created an issue regarding Pieces OS not starting due to database corruption.
* Pieces support bot suggested similar issues and resources.
* Mark from Pieces identified the issue as a duplicate of another one.

**Problems identified:**
* Pieces OS failed to start due to database corruption.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**
* Continue discussion on the original issue: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/686

**Current status/outcome:**
* Issue identified as a duplicate. User directed to the original issue for further discussion.

## Conversation Summary: 

**Key points:**

* **Initial issue:** User reported an error during database initial bootup.
* **Troubleshooting:** Pieces support attempted to debug the issue remotely and suggested deleting the database folder.
* **Problem identified:** User's computer lacked AVX2 instruction set support, required by the CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch library used by Pieces OS.
* **Solution proposed:** Pieces support identified the core issue and developed a fix in version 11.3.2.
* **Outcome:** The issue was resolved with the release of version 11.3.2.

**Current status:** 

* The issue is resolved.
* Version 11.3.2 of Pieces OS is available with the fix.

**Further details:**

* The user provided valuable information about their hardware limitations, which helped identify the cause of the problem.
* Pieces support was responsive and communicated effectively throughout the process.

**Additional notes:**

* The user expressed concern about compatibility with older hardware, and Pieces support acknowledged this. 


**Overall, this conversation demonstrates the importance of clear communication and collaborative troubleshooting in resolving technical issues.**

recommendations: **Prioritize authentication issues:** The most frequent and active tickets revolve around authentication problems in Pieces OS, especially related to account linking, login failures, and HTTP errors. Focus on resolving these issues to improve user experience.

**Investigate and address database corruption:** Several tickets report Pieces OS crashing or failing to launch due to database corruption on both macOS and Windows. This seems to be a recurring problem affecting multiple users, requiring immediate attention and a permanent fix.

**Improve error messaging and logging:** Vague error messages like "Unexpected error occurred" make it difficult for users to understand the problem and for support to diagnose the issue. Enhance error messages and logging to provide more specific information.

**Consider hardware compatibility:** Issues related to AVX2 instruction set incompatibility highlight the importance of considering hardware limitations. Ensure software compatibility with a wider range of hardware or provide clear system requirements to users.

**Update documentation:**  The workaround involving WinGet for installation should be incorporated into the official documentation to help users facing similar issues. Keep documentation up-to-date with known issues, workarounds, and troubleshooting steps.

**Proactively monitor for recurring issues:**  Develop a system to track and analyze support tickets for recurring patterns. This will help identify and address systemic problems proactively, reducing the overall ticket volume in the future.
